p:
The pooled overall cumulative relationship between relative risk (RR) of infectious gastroenteritis and temperature, illustrated in Fig. 1, exhibited a broadly inverted U-shape. The highest pooled overall RR was 1.08 (95% CI: 1.01, 1.15) in the 59.9th percentile of temperature. The multivariate Cochran Q test for heterogeneity was significant ( p < 0.001), and the related I
2 statistic indicated that 83.1% of the variability was due to true heterogeneity between prefectures.
